document_data.caption: The vampire lord Artor Morlin
document_data.name: Artor Morlin
document_data.aliases: Delinth Oberlin{{Cite dungeon/128/Vampires of Waterdeep: The Fireplace Level}}
document_data.nicknames: Baron of Blood{{Cite dungeon/126/Vampires of Waterdeep: Blood of Malar|75}}
document_data.Relationships:
Artor didn't maintain many relationships for a centuries-old person. He preferred to kill his allies after a certain number of years and make new ones rather than keep the same ones around for a long time. He maintained a coterie of vampire spawn, the last of whom that were documented being [[Arrick Kaarvol]], [[Fhang]], [[Rorrina Stoneshaft|Rorrina]] of [[Clan Stoneshaft]] and a [[medusa]] named [[Medechai]] who was his favorite.

He had made several acquaintances in his time, including [[Halaster Blackcloak]], whom he first met before he became undead when Halaster was still known as Hilather. Of his true friends though, there were very few, though it was known that [[Durnan]] was one.

Through Fhang, Artor had a connection to the [[Unseen]]. He also had connections within the [[Church of Loviatar]] and the [[Shadow Thieves]].

He was closely connected to the [[Gost]] family of Waterdeep, in a relationship dating back for centuries. In the late 14th Century DR, [[Djarrus Gost]] was his ''[[Dominate person|dominated]]'' puppet (a fact that would've shocked Djarrus' vampire-hunting half-sister [[Corinna Lathankin]] if she'd ever found out). Artor maintained dominated servants that were connected to the [[church of Lathander]] in order to supply information to the church about rival vampires which would then be destroyed by church-sponsored vampire hunters.
document_data.Possessions:
* Artor wielded a ''+2 [[Vampiric (weapon quality)|vampiric]] two-bladed sword'' in combat that he named ''[[Shoonfangs]]''. He frequently coated it in [[purple worm]] poison. It was also the key to a ''[[portal]]'' that linked the [[Fireplace Level]] to the Morlin Catacombs underneath [[Castle Daggerford]] - Morlin's emergency escape route.
* Artor wore a [[mithral]] chain shirt called ''[[Artor's Armament]]''.
* He also kept a 6 inch (15 cm) [[bloodstone]] gem, carved into the shape of a bowl that would fill with blood on command.
* Artor's coffin was finely carved black [[marble]] and worth thousands of [[gold pieces]] to a collector.{{Cite dungeon/128/Vampires of Waterdeep: The Fireplace Level|88}}
* Artor acquired one of two known copies of the ''[[Workbook of Lhoril Delhiirnyn]]'' that contained extensive research on summoning [[demon]]s and a list of treasures seen in [[Ahghairon's Tower]] before it was spellwarded.
* A pair of ''[[boots of elvenkind]]''.
* A ''[[kiira]]'' that contained the spells ''[[analyze dweomer]]'', ''[[contact other plane]]'', ''[[moment of prescience]]'', ''[[Scrying (spell)|scrying]]'', and ''[[vision]]''.
* Twin ''[[dagger of venom|daggers of venom]]'' decorated with [[jewels]], stolen from the noble [[Sultlue]] family of Waterdeep.
* A book describing religious rituals of the [[yuan-ti]].
* A pair of dueling swords won by defeating a young scion of the [[Silmerhelve]] noble family. Artor posed as a rival and acquired a ''[[rapier of puncturing]]'' and a ''[[luck blade]]'' (with no [[wish]]es left).
* Artor had a large collection of treasures from the time of the [[Shoon Imperium]]{{Cite dungeon/127/Vampires of Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Crypt|63}} including a suit of ''[[red dragon|red]] [[dragonhide]] [[full plate]]'' armor once worn by a [[helmed horror]] made by the Shoon court mages.
